current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend part E of title IV of the Social Security Act to
		  remove barriers to the adoption of children in foster care through
		  reauthorization and improvement of the adoption incentives program, and for
		  other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Removing Barriers to Adoption and

National

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop national standards for home
				studies for use in evaluating potential foster and adoptive parents. In
				developing these standards, the

shall consult with a working group

				in the field of social work, State child welfare leaders and other qualified
				individuals.

				services;

term.#tail:
means services for children placed in adoptive,
				kinship, or guardianship placements and their families, and may include any or
				all of the following:

text.#text:
Training of
				public adoption personnel, personnel of private child welfare and adoption
				agencies licensed by the State to provide adoption services, mental health
				services professionals, and other support personnel to provide services under
				this part and part E.

Assistance to
				support groups for adoptive parents, adopted children, and siblings of adopted
				children.

Rigorous
				evaluations of post-adoption and post-permanency
				services.

provides that
				the State will engage in public-private partnerships to promote evidence-based
				child-focused recruitment practices that focus measurable attention on the
				adoption of children out of foster care with an emphasis on those children most
				at risk of aging out of care
				.

text.#text:
The individuals

The individuals

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Removing Barriers to Adoption and Supporting Families Act of 2013/s:9/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: E of title IV of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines requires State legislation
			 (other than legislation appropriating funds) in order for the plan to meet the
			 additional requirements imposed by this Act, the State plan shall not be
			 regarded as failing to comply with the requirements of such part solely on the
			 basis of the failure of the plan to meet such additional requirements before
			 the 1st day of the 1st calendar quarter beginning after the close of the 1st
			 regular session of the State legislature that ends after the 1-year period
			 beginning with the date of the enactment of this Act. For purposes of the
			 preceding sentence, in the case of a State that has a 2-year legislative
			 session, each year of the session is deemed to be a separate regular session of
			 the State legislature.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
